com.foreach.across.core

Class AcrossContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.foreach.across.core.context.AbstractAcrossEntity
      • com.foreach.across.core.AcrossContext
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AcrossEntity, org.springframework.beans.factory.DisposableBean

    public class AcrossContext
extends AbstractAcrossEntity
implements org.springframework.beans.factory.DisposableBean
    Main class representing a set of Across modules. This class takes care of managing the global Spring ApplicationContext related to all modules, and will make sure that different modules are handled in the order in which they are registered.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AcrossContext

        public AcrossContext()
        Constructs a new AcrossContext in its own ApplicationContext. Modules in this context will not be able to use any beans defined outside the AcrossContext.

      • AcrossContext

        public AcrossContext(org.springframework.context.ApplicationContext parentContext)
        Constructs a new AcrossContext that is a child of the parent ApplicationContext passed in. Modules can access all beans from the parent context, and exposed beans will be copied to the parent context so non-Across beans can access them.
        Parameters:
        parentContext - Parent ApplicationContext.

      • isDisableNoOpCacheManager

        public boolean isDisableNoOpCacheManager()
        Specifies whether we want to fall back on a NoOpCacheManager when asking the global cache manager for a specific cache instance. Leaving this enabled potentially avoids many null checks when dealing with the caching layer. It does open up the potential for misconfigured caches, as you might inadvertently omit configurations.
        Returns:
        true if we do not want to fall back on a NoOpCacheManager
        See Also:
        AcrossCompositeCacheManager

      • setDisableNoOpCacheManager

        public void setDisableNoOpCacheManager(boolean disableNoOpCacheManager)

      • addModule

        public void addModule(@NonNull
                      @NonNull AcrossModule module)

      • getModule

        public AcrossModule getModule(String name)
        Gets the module with the given name if present on the context.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the module.
        Returns:
        AcrossModule or null if not present.

      • getModule

        public <U extends AcrossModule> U getModule(String name,
                                            Class<U> moduleType)
        Gets the module with the given name if present on the context. Requires the module to be of the specific type, if this is not the case a ClassCastException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the module
        moduleType - Required module type
        Returns:
        AcrossModule or null if not present

      • getInstallerSettings

        public InstallerSettings getInstallerSettings()
        Gets the InstallerSettings attached to this context. A context should always have specific InstallerSettings, so this method can never return null.
        Returns:
        InstallerSettings instance.

      • setInstallerSettings

      • getInstallerAction

        public InstallerAction getInstallerAction()
        Shortcut method that returns the default action on the InstallerSettings attached to the context.
        Returns:
        InstallerAction that is the default for the entire context.

      • setInstallerAction

        Shortcut method to set the default action on the InstallerSettings attached to the context.
        Parameters:
        defaultAction - InstallerAction to set as default.

      • getApplicationContextConfigurers

        public Map<ApplicationContextConfigurer,ConfigurerScope> getApplicationContextConfigurers()

      • addApplicationContextConfigurer

        public void addApplicationContextConfigurer(ApplicationContextConfigurer configurer,
                                            ConfigurerScope scope)

        Add an ApplicationContextConfigurer to the AcrossContext. Depending on the scope the configurer will be applied to the root ApplicationContext only or to every ApplicationContext of every module registered.

        The latter is required for configurers providing BeanFactoryPostProcessor beans like property sources.

        Parameters:
        configurer - Configurer instance.
        scope - Scope to which this configurer should be applied.
        See Also:
        ConfigurerScope

      • addInstallerContextConfigurer

        public void addInstallerContextConfigurer(ApplicationContextConfigurer configurer)

        Add an ApplicationContextConfigurer to the installer context of every module.

        Parameters:
        configurer - Configurer instance.
        See Also:
        ConfigurerScope

      • getInstallerContextConfigurers

        public List<ApplicationContextConfigurer> getInstallerContextConfigurers()

      • setExposeTransformer

        public void setExposeTransformer(ExposedBeanDefinitionTransformer exposeTransformer)
        Sets the transformer that will be applied to all exposed beans before actually copying them to the parent context.
        Parameters:
        exposeTransformer - The transformer that should be applies to all exposed beans.

      • getModuleDependencyResolver

      • setModuleDependencyResolver

        public void setModuleDependencyResolver(ModuleDependencyResolver moduleDependencyResolver)
        Sets the instance to be used for resolving the module dependencies. If none is configured all modules will have to be added explicitly.
        Parameters:
        moduleDependencyResolver - instance

      • publishEvent

        public void publishEvent(Object event)
        Shortcut method to publish an event synchronously on the AcrossContext event bus. For more fine-grained functionality like asynchronous publishing, use the AcrossEventPublisher.
        Parameters:
        event - Event instance that will be published.
